head.supplied: Melbourne 31/12/84. ¶ T. R. Wilson Esqr, ¶ Undersecretary. ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ In reply to your memorandum (B.11880) of yesterday, ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that no one, whose position had been disco...

div.p: C85/4, unit 79, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In reply to your memorandum (B.11880) of yesterday,
Memorandum not found. I have the honor to inform you, that no one, whose position had been discontinued in an other Department by resignation or reduction, has become engaged in the establishment of the Gov. Botanist; but Mr C. French senior was transferred from a position in the botanic garden to a place in my establishment, and I have therefore attached a memorandum to that effect herewith.
The memorandum below was written by G. Luehmann. Minutes, in unknown hands, asked if the change was reported to the Public Service Board, with the reply 'Yes'.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Return of Employés transferred from other departments.
French, Charles, senior, Assistant; transferred at his request from the Botanic Garden on 1st March 1884, where he had been employed since 1st April 1865. No reductions made and no compensation paid.
